title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 31 May 2012 - XWiki
content:
01:27 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r1159fbc https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/1159fbccd31093cb08deeab705deba575cb4179e / (4 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7864: Allow the Hibernate connection URL configuration to use the Environment Permanent Directory property - http://git.io/5DNrvg  
01:54 <Shaddox> has quit  
02:02 <@cjd> AndreasJonsson: can you take a look at this? http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster/1338/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.cluster/DocumentCacheTest/testDocumentCacheSync/  
02:02 <@cjd> I need to get some sleep  
02:41 <sdumitriu> has quit  
05:44 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:06 <Denis> has quit  
08:06 <CIA-87> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-diff-display \* r6275a3b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/6275a3bfa5b5abe909b114b13cc7ee48ecd1f45e / (24 files in 10 dirs): XCOMMONS-184: Introduce API to display diffs in various formats - http://git.io/mXqCnQ  
08:24 <tekzilla> has quit  
08:26 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <vmassol> cjd: ah thanks for the commit. I now understands. It was working fine on my machine since I had it and I forgot to push it....  
09:01 <vmassol> checking now the diff with my local changes  
09:15 <vmassol> cjd: fixing stuff  
09:30 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <abusenius> has quit  
09:39 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
09:40 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <CIA-87> Vincent Massol master \* r1fad464 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/1fad4647889dd2110660c4821cff0cb2f07a4778 / (5 files in 5 dirs): XWIKI-7864: Allow the Hibernate connection URL configuration to use the Environment Permanent Directory property - http://git.io/B7U\_2g  
09:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you think you could check the debian installer to see if it's still ok? Ideally you should also replace the hardcoded "data" value with the value of the property ${xwiki.properties.environment.permanentDirectory}  
09:54 <+tmortagne> vmassol: as I said in the mail the debian installed set a permanent directory already following debian standards  
09:54 <+tmortagne> it's you don't have the hardcoded data in the configuration file  
09:54 <+tmortagne> s/it's/so/  
09:54 <vmassol> I see this:  
09:55 <vmassol> ah no forget it  
09:55 <vmassol> it should ok now  
09:55 <vmassol> I think it was busted with caleb's changes  
09:55 <vmassol> but I've modified them back so it should be ok hopefully  
09:55 <vmassol> It wouldn't hurt to verify though  
09:58 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
09:58 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
10:45 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <@cjd> vmassol: thanks for taking care of that.  
10:51 <vmassol> np, thanks to you  
10:51 <@cjd> Given I've seen no responses on the list, I guess I'll start actually building the release  
10:52 <@cjd> should we try the installer quickly or are you confident that it's right  
10:52 <@cjd> ?  
10:52 <vmassol> I've tested the generic installer on my machine  
10:52 <@cjd> awesome  
10:53 <vmassol> I'm now working on supporting windows7 for RC1  
10:58 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r2716085 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2716085afeb76396c34331de909cf6e91b2efb7c / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources\_zh.properties : [release] Updated translations. - http://git.io/aleAMA  
11:02 <evalica> has quit  
11:02 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <+tmortagne> cjd: about XALOCALIZATION-16 you should actually use mvn xar:format which is supposed to take care of producing a valid xml page instead of a custom script until the support is added in l10n  
11:09 <@cjd> awesome, I'll add that to my release.translations.sh  
11:09 <@cjd> and I need to push that to xwiki-release-scripts...  
11:10 <+tmortagne> would be nice indeed  
11:10 <@cjd> is agent1's key in your github account?  
11:11 <+tmortagne> probably forgot to remove it yes  
11:11 <@cjd> I might propose adding a dedicated key for the agent so we can streamline this process..  
11:12 <+tmortagne> cjd: what do you mean ? having a personal key for the RM like we do for gpg or have a dedicated release account ?  
11:13 <@cjd> a dedicated "releaser" github account is what I was thinking  
11:14 <+tmortagne> ok, indeed would make the release simpler and the history would be more clear probably too  
11:17 <+sburjan> Hello, I have noticed that http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/WikiManager/ is accesible for unlogged users and some of the wiki's have a delete button available. For example: http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiServerJv (I didn't hit the delete button to test if it really deletes it or now), should this info be available for unlogged users? Also, http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/WikiManager/CreateNewWikiSettings has the following error  
11:17 <+sburjan> : "Error number 4001 in 4: Error while parsing velocity page xwiki:WikiManager.CreateNewWikiSettings Wrapped Exception: Failed to evaluate content with id Create New Wiki Settings"  
11:17 <+sburjan> also, http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/WikiManager/WikiConfiguration has "Uninstall" available for those applications.  
11:17 <+sburjan> even when NOT logged in  
11:52 <ssavi> has quit  
12:10 <CIA-87> tmortagne feature-diff-display \* r2cfc23b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/2cfc23bdc51c48c259760aa91d1babbba86719bd / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-diff/xwiki-commons-diff-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/diff/DiffResult.java : XCOMMONS-184: Introduce API to display diffs in various formats - http://git.io/W76WNg  
12:12 <+tmortagne> sburjan: no idea what http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/WikiManager/WikiConfiguration is, it's not part of standard wiki manager  
12:12 <+tmortagne> as for the delete button it sounds like a bug unless the page is not the default one but don't worry about right the API is taking care of it anyway  
12:13 <+tmortagne> I can't see any delete button when not logged in  
12:14 <+tmortagne> ho you mean in the descriptor  
12:14 <+tmortagne> that button is not here to delete the wiki  
12:14 <+tmortagne> it only for aliases  
12:14 <+tmortagne> but indeed it should be displayed only if the user has edit right on the page  
12:16 <@cjd> jvdrean: you reported a blocker for 4.1M2, http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7842  
12:16 <@cjd> Should this be changed or do we need to hold up the release over it?  
12:17 <+jvdrean> cjd: I reported it, vmassol marked it as blocker + set the fix version  
12:17 <+jvdrean> IMHO it can be pushed to RC  
12:17 <vmassol> checking  
12:17 <+tmortagne> cjd: not a real blocker for the M2 IMO  
12:18 <@cjd> is http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7785 complete?  
12:19 <vmassol> it's a regression and thus a blocker but not for our release since we still bundle the legacy modules  
12:19 <vmassol> however I think we should still consider it a blocker for 4.1 final ATM  
12:19 <vmassol> so that we fix it ASAP  
12:19 <vmassol> let me change the fixfor version to RC1  
12:20 <@cjd> Is anyone taking care of it?  
12:20 <vmassol> cjd: just moved and commented  
12:21 <vmassol> we need a volunteer for it  
12:21 <vmassol> tmortagne would be a good candidate :)  
12:21 <+tmortagne> don't have much time for it  
12:22 <vmassol> who moved parseMessage to legacy?  
12:22 <vmassol> the first "bug" is to have deprecated parseMessage without a replacement  
12:22 <vmassol> the second one is to have moved parseMessage to legacy  
12:22 <vmassol> I personally hate that we deprecated it without solution  
12:22 <vmassol> (I think thomas did this)  
12:22 <vmassol> because weh've add warnings in the console for a very long time now because of this  
12:23 <vmassol> s/add/had/  
12:23 <vmassol> in any case right now we should move it back our of legacy since it's used  
12:23 <vmassol> let's find out why moved it  
12:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: you did the move to legacy apparently in XWIKI-6741  
12:25 <vmassol> could you put it back please since it's still used?  
12:27 <@cjd> I gather http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7652 <-- this has been delayed until RC1? tmortagne ?  
12:27 <+tmortagne> vmassol: if you want  
12:28 <vmassol> just commented: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7842?focusedCommentId=70875#comment-70875  
12:28 <vmassol> ;)  
12:28 <+tmortagne> cjd: yes it has been delayed but will probably be more 4.2  
12:29 <@cjd> ok, would you mind editing the issue?  
12:29 <+tmortagne> cjd: I did  
12:30 <@cjd> cool  
12:31 <@cjd> I'm going to punt http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7785 since I think it's fixed but it's definitely not documented or in the release notes.  
12:32 <vmassol> I don't think it's been done at all  
12:32 <vmassol> did you check the commits?  
12:32 <+tmortagne> I thin it has been done in a branch  
12:32 <+tmortagne> but I don't think it's already in master  
12:32 <vmassol> yep my thinking too  
12:32 <vmassol> I'm moving it 4.2  
12:32 <@cjd> Oh ok, I thought it had something todo with the wysiwyg-war which was breaking things earlier  
12:32 <@cjd> cool  
12:35 <vmassol> done  
12:40 <@cjd> should I include the aspectj ninja methods in the api breaks section or manually remove them?  
12:40 <vmassol> they're not breakages  
12:40 <vmassol> that's the point :)  
12:40 <vmassol> in some future we could separate the section in 2  
12:41 <vmassol> f(or people who don't use the legacy modules)  
12:41 <@cjd> ok  
12:41 <vmassol> in any case what I mean is that we need a section for people to see breakages when they're using the legacy modules  
12:41 <vmassol> this is the most important one ATM  
12:42 <vmassol> the other one is kinda optional but you can also have it if you want (nice to have)  
12:42 <@cjd> I think methods like this  
12:42 <@cjd> ajc$privFieldSet$com\_xpn\_xwiki\_XWikiCompatibilityAspect$com\_xpn\_xwiki\_XWiki$virtualWikiMap()  
12:42 <@cjd> are actually changing  
12:42 <@cjd> but they're secret and undocumented  
12:42 <vmassol> I don't understand  
12:42 <vmassol> why do you mention this?  
12:42 <vmassol> you should never see this  
12:42 <@cjd> clirr spots it as a removed method  
12:43 <vmassol> nope  
12:43 <vmassol> it's the wrong  
12:43 <vmassol> version  
12:43 <vmassol> see the comment I put  
12:43 <@cjd> oh yes, I had to revert the version of clirr and run that again  
12:53 <florinciu> has quit  
13:12 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
13:17 <evalica> has quit  
13:20 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:28 <@cjd> vmassol: rebuilt with aspectj 1.6.7, still has magic ajc$ methods, I'm going to remove them manually since fooling around with versions and checking parts of it differently seems far more haphazard than just removing the aj internal methods manually.  
13:29 <vmassol> yes manually removing them should be ok  
13:29 <vmassol> it's strange though  
13:30 <@cjd> Also I expect that to continue because I think it's not related to the upgrade but rather the changes made on deprecation day.  
13:30 <vmassol> ?  
13:30 <vmassol> I really checked them all  
13:30 <vmassol> I don't understand what you mean  
13:31 <@cjd> when you add something to the compatibility aspect, aj adds a secret method to the woven class so it can access things at runtime  
13:31 <vmassol> sure  
13:31 <@cjd> when something is not needed anymore, it stops adding the secret method  
13:31 <vmassol> and?  
13:31 <vmassol> why is something not needed anymore?  
13:32 <vmassol> if we remove a method from legacy we create a breakage so that's prefectly normal  
13:32 <@cjd> because another method was moved to the compatibility aspect which makes it able to access what it needs a different way I assume.  
13:32 <vmassol> I don't understand what yo mean by this  
13:33 <vmassol> what has another method anything to do with an method already in elgacy?  
13:33 <@cjd> hmm also if another public method is added to the class which makes the secret method redundant, it stands to reason that aj would remove it.  
13:34 <@cjd> com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki: Removed field ajc$interField$com\_xpn\_xwiki\_api\_XWikiCompatibilityAspect$util  
13:34 <vmassol> well if a neutrino interacts with the computer while it builds it'll also cause a problem ::)  
13:35 <vmassol> but that's unlikely to happen  
13:35 <vmassol> AFAIK there's no reason that what you mention happens  
13:35 <@cjd> this example is likely because aj needed a method of getting util from XWiki, now Util is in the aspect so it nolonger needs that method.  
13:35 <vmassol> or you need to provide a use case 'cause I can't see one  
13:36 <vmassol> we'll see when it happens  
13:36 <vmassol> in any case we have a solution so we're good  
13:36 <@cjd> At any rate, we are relying on what is inherently undefined behavior because aj doesn't promise to make any method at any time.  
13:36 <@cjd> anything starting with ajc$ could appear or disappear at any moment  
13:36 <vmassol> again we've already discussed this  
13:36 <vmassol> and we already have a solution  
13:36 <@cjd> ok  
13:37 <vmassol> so I 'm not sure what you're trying to discuss here :)  
13:37 <vmassol> the solution being to add support for excludes in the clirr plugin  
13:37 <@cjd> that works for me.  
13:37 <vmassol> and exclude all aspect-internal methods  
13:37 <vmassol> and fields  
13:37 <vmassol> good  
13:38 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <Inge-> Can I ask a n00b question here?  Yesterday, running the standalone xwiki on win7 worked fine (start\_xwiki.bat). Today it starts up fine, but I only get an error in the browser:  net::ERR\_CONNECTION\_RESET  and if I try to telnet to localhost:8080 and do GET / I get nothing and the telnet connection closes.  
13:47 <@cjd> it sounds like xwiki is not running when you try to connect  
13:48 <Inge-> It had bound to the port.  
13:48 <@cjd> reset connection generally means there is no program bound to the port at all.  
13:49 <@cjd> Perhaps try stopping it and starting it again and if the problem persists then copy the log output to a pastebin  
13:49 <Inge-> well, if I stopped xwiki, telnet does not connect at all  
13:49 <@cjd> ahh I see  
13:49 <Inge-> I checked the jetty log, which showed it had given a 302 response to my GET /, so I tried getting /swiki/bin/view/Main. That caused it to think for a while, print something about storage schema updates, and then it returned the main page  
13:49 <Inge-> and now it works  
13:49 <Inge-> That was weird.  
13:50 <@cjd> ahh so it fails to load http://127.0.0.1:8080/ but it loads 127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ ??  
13:50 <Inge-> I can't really say. It failed before, but now / redirects to /xwiki/bin/view/Main  
13:51 <vmassol> looks like a network issue on your OS  
13:51 <Inge-> netstat didn't show port 8080 bound to anything either  
13:52 <Inge-> Anyway, I'm a .net developer, but xwiki looks like the best wiki I have so far found.  
13:52 <@cjd> \o/  
13:52 <vmassol> cool :)  
13:53 <Inge-> But a bit of a learning curve :)  
13:53 <vmassol> yeah… we're working on that… feedback most welcome on how to improve further! A mail on the list explaining what you think should be improved would be just great :)  
13:55 <Inge-> subscribed to the user mailing list now.  
13:57 <vmassol> great  
13:59 <Inge-> Is development of the Office add-in dead?  
13:59 <vmassol> kind of yes  
13:59 <vmassol> the main committer is busy elsewhere  
13:59 <vmassol> we're waiting for someone else to jump in  
14:00 <Inge-> I'm kind of ambivalent - on the one hand the idea of editing in Word is very appealing. On the other hand, there is quite a disconnect in the functionality, so I am not sure how much sense it makes.  
14:01 <Inge-> I tried it out, but ended up preferring to use the wysiwyg + source editor instead  
14:01 <vmassol> cool then :) It's more to help strong word users transition  
14:01 <vmassol> (IMO)  
14:01 <Inge-> Right.  
14:32 <+sburjan> can I test a little bit M2 ? I see we already built it  
14:34 <vmassol> cjd: btw were all the tests passing when you started the release?  
14:35 <vmassol> answer: seems so: http://ci.xwiki.org/ there's one failure but hopefully it's a fuke  
14:37 <+sburjan> thank you  
14:47 <@cjd> I looked at that issue and it did indeed look like a slicker.  
14:47 <@cjd> \*flicker  
14:47 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:47 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:53 <@cjd> FRSRelease::update() Error On Update: ERROR: syntax error at or near "s" LINE 5: ...sion brings improvements to the Extension Manager' <-- silly mysql  
14:54 <@cjd> funny that XWiki is so good about that kind of thing that it's almost unheard of  
14:55 <+sburjan> Denis: ping. I see there is a user complaining on the users list about Oracle migration. I have tried to reproduce his issue but without success  
14:55 <+Denis> sburjan: I am really busy, I cannot help right now  
14:56 <+sburjan> ok  
15:04 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle xwiki-commons-4.1-milestone-2 \* rd889362 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/d889362dda83c51595f0b777de935dc5209a0e78 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-commons-4.1-milestone-2 - http://git.io/mToi2A  
15:04 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle xwiki-commons-4.1-milestone-2 \* re352346 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/e35234604441640a3896a07c0521557870fc4cd3 / (58 files in 58 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-commons-4.1-milestone-2 - http://git.io/e\_SN0w  
15:04 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle xwiki-rendering-4.1-milestone-2 \* r873d03d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/873d03d05dcbc4d8549900a8fe0404ad0eb3e8c8 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-rendering-4.1-milestone-2 - http://git.io/qK-B2A  
15:05 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle xwiki-rendering-4.1-milestone-2 \* r3c9de54 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/3c9de54a810dea6ea462505e8cd39eb7175fb39b / (43 files in 43 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-rendering-4.1-milestone-2 - http://git.io/4Koy5A  
15:06 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle xwiki-enterprise-4.1-milestone-2 \* r593024a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/593024a8db8dcf27bc3b6888dab6eebd8dad8001 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-enterprise-4.1-milestone-2 - http://git.io/RYcyAw  
15:06 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle xwiki-enterprise-4.1-milestone-2 \* r24e4b9d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/24e4b9d24d0deb8a77c3aad49d98a25ae9b47cf0 / (47 files in 47 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-enterprise-4.1-milestone-2 - http://git.io/orMvEg  
15:06 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle xwiki-manager-4.1-milestone-2 \* r65f22bc https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/65f22bc8a9689c976fb99f15fd331836b7129ca6 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-manager-4.1-milestone-2 - http://git.io/35diBQ  
15:06 <CIA-87> Caleb James DeLisle xwiki-manager-4.1-milestone-2 \* rd668577 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/d6685775d26b4a8d30c7b69a739790f8f4207cde / (16 files in 16 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-manager-4.1-milestone-2 - http://git.io/Q2ZK1g  
15:11 <+tmortagne> cjd: is that expected that there is commits on everything bug platform here ?  
15:12 <@cjd> I don't follow  
15:12 <+tmortagne> seems like it has been skipped but maybe it's normal, just seems weird enough to me for a release to warn you ;)  
15:12 <+tmortagne> I don't see any  "[release] Preparing release" for platform  
15:13 <+tmortagne> like everything was released except platform  
15:13 <@cjd> oh yes, that's because it released out of a branch  
15:13 <@cjd> I can push the branch if you'd like but it doesn't seem to make much sense  
15:13 <+tmortagne> I'm just surprised platform is not released like everything else  
15:14 <@cjd> oh oops, it looks like I forgot to push platform tag  
15:15 <@cjd> thankyou for talling me  
15:15 <+tmortagne> isn't this done by the script ?  
15:16 <@cjd> I don't use that whole script because it seems very magical and error prone, also it doesn't support staging  
15:16 <@cjd> I'm working on a set of smaller scripts which allow the RM to verify each step along the way  
15:17 <@cjd> the whole part of editing 20 websites with curl calls is impossible to verify  
15:17 <+tmortagne> I agree with you for the push\_release script but the maven maven is nice  
15:18 <+tmortagne> s/maven maven/maven one/  
15:18 <@cjd> yes, I removed the push --tags part because since it uses staging, you don't want to push the tags until the testing phase is complete  
15:18 <@cjd> so I just need another step to handle that part  
15:19 <+tmortagne> sure  
15:19 <@cjd> I will put what I'm working off of into the release-scripts repo since it has made this release very easy (all three times ;) )  
15:19 <+tmortagne> yep you be nice to have your translation script for one  
15:20 <@cjd> yes, that thing is golden  
15:20 <+tmortagne> btw is ok ok to push things now ?
